html: A great wedding feast marks the unconditional covenant Jehovah makes with his people and with individuals (cf. Isaiah 54:5-10; 55:3). Returnees from exile (Isaiah 43:6-7; 49:22; 60:4) marry those at home. Joy and rejoicing characterize all whom Jehovah redeems at his coming: “Rejoice, then, and be glad forever in what I create. See, I create Jerusalem to be a delight and its people a joy. I will delight in Jerusalem, rejoice in my people” (Isaiah 65:18-19); “This is our God, whom we expected would save us. This is Jehovah for whom we have waited; let us joyfully celebrate his salvation!” (Isaiah 25:9).
